that be not quite what the ' mitochondrial eve ' hypothesis posit . science . 1995 dec 22 ; 270 ( 5244 ) : 1930 - 6 . the myth of eve : molecular biology and human origin . ayala fj . university of california , irvine , usa . it have be propose that modern human descend from a single woman , the `` mitochondrial eve `` who live in africa 100,000 to 200,000 year ago . the human immune system drb1 gene be extremely polymorphic , with gene lineage that coalesce into an ancestor who live around 60 million year ago , a time before the divergence of the ape from the old world monkey . the theory of gene coalescence suggest that , throughout the last 60 million year , human ancestral population have an effective size of 100,000 individual or great . molecular evolution data favor the african origin of modern human , but the weight of the evidence be against a population bottleneck before their emergence . the mitochondrial eve hypothesis emanate from a confusion between gene genealogy and individual genealogy .
